Aline Cedrac.Action: Politely questions the delivery of an unscheduled crate, showing responsibility and attentiveness.
Checks her clipboard carefully and questions the delivery, showing attention to detail and responsibility.
Takes initiative to open crate and handle artifacts carefully, shows fascination with the tablet.
Responds awkwardly and quickly leaves when her missing boyfriend is mentioned, avoiding further interaction.
Takes initiative to open the crate despite instructions that only Dr. Hudgens should open it, showing confidence and practical problem-solving to continue work in his absence.
Explains her role clearly and demonstrates knowledge about the artifacts and ongoing work, indicating skill and responsibility.
Reacts awkwardly and quickly leaves when the guard mentions her missing boyfriend, showing emotional vulnerability but also discretion.
Inspects the stone tablet carefully and records detailed observations about the pictograms, identifying them as late-period Abkani and interpreting their meaning as a prophecy.
Inspects the stone tablet and takes notes carefully, showing attention to detail and methodical behavior.
Notices the faint glow and low hum from the drawers, reacts with cautious curiosity by approaching and reaching out to open a glowing drawer.
Answers phone politely and tries to explain her actions regarding the shipment and cataloguing the pictograms.
Continues to try to justify her actions despite being abruptly cut off and ordered to stop by Dr. Hudgens.
Shows frustration after being hung up on, but does not respond with anger or rudeness.
Starts decoding pictograms on a shipment without explicit permission, showing initiative and skill.
Continues to explain her actions despite being interrupted and ordered to stop, indicating confidence but possibly overstepping boundaries.
Stops her work and accepts the order to leave the tablet alone after being reprimanded, showing respect for authority and restraint.
Runs up and embraces Carnby tightly upon seeing him.
Punches Carnby in the face after embracing him.
Expresses anger and distrust toward Carnby, refusing to speak to him.
Shows fascination and interest in the lynchpin artifact Carnby presents.
Admits she wished Carnby had contacted her to let her know he was alive.
Exits quickly looking anxious, shows emotional impulsiveness by punching Carnby in the face.
Immediately fascinated by the lynchpin artifact and scans a 3-D rendering into her computer, demonstrating professional skill and focus.
Questions Carnby about the artifact and his whereabouts, showing critical thinking and engagement.
Allows emotional reaction to override initial interaction with Carnby, potentially compromising a more strategic approach.
Shares knowledge about the artifacts and their origins with Carnby, showing openness and collaboration.
Takes the flashlight from Carnby to light their way, indicating cooperation and trust.
Carefully inspects and analyzes ancient artifacts, noting their origins and unique symbols.
Recognizes an unfamiliar symbol in the Abkani written language, showing attention to detail and knowledge.
Takes initiative by grabbing the flashlight and leading the way when the power goes out.
Notices Carnby's discomfort and asks him what is wrong, showing attentiveness and concern.
Leads the way with a flashlight, taking initiative to help navigate the dark hallway.
Makes a lighthearted comment about her life getting complicated when Carnby shows up, indicating a friendly and familiar rapport.
Leads the way with a flashlight through a dark, flickering hallway, showing initiative and readiness.
Notices Carnby's unease and responds appropriately, indicating awareness and attentiveness.
Engages in light banter with Carnby, maintaining composure despite tense circumstances.
Leads the way with the flashlight in a dimly lit, potentially dangerous environment, showing initiative and calm.
Hands over the flashlight to Carnby without hesitation when he draws his revolver, indicating trust and teamwork.
Conceals herself behind columns and scans the area carefully before stepping out, demonstrating caution and situational awareness.
Is about to speak but is stopped by Carnby, showing restraint and respect for team dynamics.
Freezes and does not move when confronted with terrifying creatures.
Scrambles to her feet and runs quickly to safety, closing the door behind her.
Allows Carnby to push her into the storage room for safety, cooperates in escape attempt.
Fumbles for keys under extreme pressure, does not panic or abandon effort.
No indication of selfishness or abandoning Carnby despite danger and injury.
Finds the right key and attempts to lock the door under extreme pressure.
Drops the keys after being injured by the creature's claws.
Finds the right key and locks the door to protect Carnby and herself from the creature.
Responds sharply to Carnby's question about escape, 'No! Why didn't you ask me that before you pushed me in here?'
Motions to the double-doors leading to the front entrance, helping guide their escape.
Finds the right key quickly and secures the door against a strong attack.
Informs Carnby there is no way out, showing awareness of their situation.
Unlocks the door cautiously after the crashing stops, showing situational awareness and prudence.
Leads Carnby towards the front entrance and takes the flashlight, indicating leadership and readiness.
Runs alongside Carnby to escape the invisible creatures, showing presence of mind under pressure.
Relies on external rescue (Bureau 713 agents) rather than taking independent action to confront or evade the creatures.
Stands back with Carnby, not interfering with the Agents' operation, recognizing they are not equipped to help.
Does not attempt to engage or assist despite the chaotic situation, showing restraint and situational awareness.
Acknowledges that the agents saved their lives.
Acknowledges that the agents saved their lives, showing awareness of the situation and giving credit appropriately.
Stands with Carnby and Agent Barr during a tense security sweep, maintaining composure.
Maintains composure despite being injured and surprised by Burke's knowledge of her.
Allows herself to be escorted out by Agent Miles without resistance, showing trust in others' competence.
Nods politely to the medic and speaks quietly with Carnby, showing cooperation and respect.
Insists on packing up priceless artifacts despite quarantine, showing concern for preservation and responsibility.
Engages in a somewhat sarcastic remark about 'out of the ordinary,' indicating a guarded or skeptical attitude.
Insists on finishing studying artifacts despite injury and quarantine, shows concern for priceless artifacts and requests to pack up her work.
Follows instructions to stay in contact and meet up later, communicates quietly and professionally with Carnby.
Challenges Commander Burke's quarantine order diplomatically to protect valuable items, demonstrating assertiveness and situational awareness.
Sits at her desk analyzing the 3-D scan she made of the lynchpin artifact.
Hesitates when asked about the origin of the artifact image, showing some guardedness.
Responds calmly to Hudgens' friendly and apologetic demeanor, indicating tolerance and composure.
Analyzes the 3-D scan of the lynchpin artifact herself and asserts she can confirm its authenticity without Hudgens' help.
Hesitates when asked about the source of the image, showing some reluctance or caution.
Smiles stiffly at Hudgens' warm smile, but engages politely by asking about the Erebus.
Confidently questions Hudgens about the Erebus, showing awareness and insight.
Uses computer technology to analyze 3-D scans and symbols, successfully correlating them to constellations.
Seemingly unaware of having a security detail until informed by Agent Cheung.
Pulls out a map and attempts to pinpoint a location using constellations and latitude/longitude calculations.
Stops and looks frustrated, acknowledging that something is missing in her analysis.
Completes copying data onto a CD and begins to pack up her belongings despite unresolved issues.
Knocks on the door when buzzer is broken, waits for answer.
Annoyed by no answer but still smiles slightly.
Uses her own key to enter the building after no response.
Finds the key she needs in her purse and uses it to unlock a broken buzzer door after knocking and receiving no answer.
Picks up Carnby's coat gently and hangs it up, showing care for his belongings.
Smiles at Carnby sleeping peacefully, indicating affection and kindness.
Lies down next to Carnby carefully, not disturbing him, showing tenderness and concern.
Notices Carnby's scars and bruises, indicating attentiveness and empathy.
Leans over and gives Carnby a light kiss while he sleeps, expressing affection and warmth.
Finds the key she's looking for and uses it to enter the loft.
Carefully climbs onto the bed without disturbing Carnby, showing awareness and tact.
Unpacks three items and places them next to the lynchpin artifact, indicating preparation and purposeful action.
Pauses and looks around the loft, calling out for Edward, showing caution and attentiveness.
Lies down next to Carnby and watches him sleep, showing emotional connection but no active problem-solving or initiative.
Lies asleep next to Carnby, allowing him to get up quietly and not disturbing him.
Prepares and places the wrapped Abkani artifacts on Carnby's work station for him to find.
Expresses appreciation for Carnby's cooking and shows enthusiasm ('I love omelettes').
Engages in collaborative discussion about the artifacts with Carnby, showing interest and openness.
Places the three Abkani artifacts carefully on Carnby's work station, indicating preparation and foresight.
Wakes up and quickly figures out a connection between the symbols on the artifacts and constellations, showing analytical thinking.
Hands Carnby the CD and collaborates on the map and calculations.
Clears the dishes after their meal while Carnby puts dishes in the sink.
Analyzes the Abkani symbols, uses constellations to calculate latitude and longitude, and inputs data into a program to find a geographical location.
Admits she cannot isolate the location closer than a hundred mile radius, showing realistic assessment of her limitations.
Grabs the flashlight and switches it on to help in a dangerous situation.
Leaps forward to retrieve Carnby's revolver to protect him from attackers.
Fires at the Female Orphan to defend herself and Carnby.
Acknowledges Carnby's difficult choice after he kills John, saying 'You had no choice.'
Struggles with the Female Orphan but manages to get away and shoots her three times, killing her with the final shot.
Does not hesitate to use her firearm effectively in a dangerous situation.
Relies on Carnby to handle the immediate threats and does not take the lead in combat.
Catches the pistol thrown to her in mid-air and checks it like a pro.
Stands her ground with Carnby facing the oncoming invisible creature, leaps out of the way at the last moment, and opens fire simultaneously with Carnby, hitting the creature dead on.
Stands together with Carnby and fires weapons in the dark at invisible creatures, maintaining composure under attack.
Fails to notice the creature rushing directly toward them while firing.
Sticks together with Carnby and shoots at the creatures, showing teamwork and calmness under pressure.
Turns and opens fire on the creature alongside Carnby, holding her own in a fierce battle, shooting at moving shadows and sticking together with a partner.
Participates actively in finishing off the remaining invisible creatures alongside Carnby and the Agents.
Questions Burke's order to Carnby by asking 'What are you doing?'
Steps in between Carnby and the Agents, putting herself at risk to protect him.
Steps in between Carnby and the Agents, putting herself at risk to protect Carnby and assert he is not an enemy.
Stays together with Carnby, dodging attacks and firing into the darkness during a chaotic battle.
Watches the other Agents, ready to step in when needed.
Exits helicopter promptly with team, ready to engage at the mine entrance.
Follows Commander Burke's lead without hesitation, showing readiness and discipline.
Observes the situation calmly and walks in step with experienced agents, showing composure in a tense environment.
Engages in the strategic discussion by acknowledging the gravity of the situation with a clear, concise statement: 'It looks like you're going to war.'
Does not take charge or offer a direct plan despite the high-stakes scenario and presence of uncertainty about the tunnel, showing some passivity.
Walks carefully down a pitch black tunnel with a team, showing caution and awareness.
Initiates a thoughtful conversation about the Abkani prophecy, indicating reflective and analytical thinking.
Approaches Carnby to look at the wiped off area and identifies the symbols as Abkani.
Joins the group in examining the walls and searching for more symbols.
Identifies faint Abkani symbols on the wall after Carnby wipes away dust and cobwebs.
Carefully climbs down the rungs of the ancient wooden ladder built into the Shaft.
Steps down on a weak rung and it breaks, causing her to almost fall.
Throws her arms around Carnby's neck and slides down the zip-line quickly to escape the falling stone column, showing presence of mind and physical capability under pressure.
Relies on Carnby to grab the zip-lines and initiate the escape, does not take independent action to secure her own safety beyond holding on.
Reads and interprets the Abkani symbols on the wall, correctly identifying them as a warning.
Engages in conversation with Carnby, providing clear and confident explanation about the warning.
Fumbles for her flashlight and uses it to repel the sand worm, showing quick thinking under pressure.
Grabs the sand worm by the torso to hold it away despite the danger, demonstrating physical courage and determination.
Falls down and her rifle is out of reach, indicating a momentary loss of control or preparedness.
Suggests a plausible hypothesis about the sand worm's life cycle, showing understanding and insight.
Examines the concrete wall carefully and correctly identifies it is not Abkani-made.
Does not suggest or attempt to find an alternative way through the sealed concrete wall, showing no immediate solution or initiative.
Questions the effectiveness of the detonator before it is triggered, showing caution and engagement in the plan.
Examines anatomical schematics and scientific diagrams carefully, showing attention to detail and understanding of the subject matter.
Asks relevant questions about the environment and situation, indicating curiosity and engagement.
Steps up confidently next to Carnby to investigate the scene, demonstrating initiative and presence of mind.
Uses her knowledge to warn the group that opening the door is a bad idea.
Advises caution and respects the warning signs instead of rushing into danger.
Uses her flashlight to read and interpret the Abkani symbols on the ancient door, recognizing the DARK SPIRIT symbol.
Identifies the Abkani device as a key fitting the door's cylindrical opening, demonstrating knowledge and preparedness.
Advises against opening the door based on the pictograms, showing caution and informed judgment.
Engages in the discussion weighing options about opening or destroying the door, contributing thoughtful input.
Grips the device tightly, showing firm and unafraid expression when threatened at gunpoint.
Grips the Abkani device tightly with a firm, unafraid expression when threatened at gunpoint.
Does not panic or show fear despite having a pistol pressed to her throat.
Complies with Carnby's serious request and cooperates by holding out the device to Hudgens.
Inserts the artifact into the device and operates it to open the door despite the tense situation with Hudgens pointing pistols.
Follows instructions carefully to insert and turn the artifact device correctly, successfully unlocking the door.
Exchanges a meaningful look with Carnby and Burke, indicating understanding of the situation and the plan involving the C-4.
Backs away from the doorway and opens fire with an assault rifle as xenomorphs emerge.
Opens fire with an assault rifle to hold off the creatures and backs away strategically from the doorway.
Shines flashlight up the ladder and climbs it confidently ahead of others.
Reaches out her hand to Carnby in a moment of crisis, showing concern for others' safety.
Reaches out to Carnby and warns him about the danger of the detonator, prompting immediate action to escape.
Quickly climbs up the ladder with Carnby and escapes the explosion by diving out of the Shaft just in time.
Expresses concern about the missing children in the orphanage.
Questions the absence of children in the orphanage, showing awareness and concern.
Walks through the orphanage with Carnby, calmly observing the environment despite the disturbing scene.
No visible panic or rash behavior despite the grim discovery and empty surroundings.
Stands ready next to Carnby in an empty, potentially dangerous downtown intersection, showing composure in an uncertain situation.
Asks a direct question about the situation, indicating awareness and engagement.
